storyInfo: On the eve of victory, the unexpected happens. Theresa is made aware of the Doctor's chaotic thoughts.

attributes.content: Someplace in the wilderness, Kazdel
...Hah.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Haha! Hahahaha!
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Prophecy? As if this could be called prophecy! Ascalon did NOT kill me!
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: What has been spoken still requires discernment, what has been discerned can still be altered. The essence of prophetic Arts is merely conjecture and calculation. No wonder there is no destiny that can't be defied!
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: The Cyclops Court is nothing more than a big, sick joke!
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: *spit* That hurts.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: I didn't die under Ascalon's blade. This isn't what I prophesized...
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Then maybe she's the one who should've died.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: She's bound to come confirm that I'm dead. When that happens, you lot can nail down her shadow and rip her to shreds.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: She's wounded too. I didn't get all beaten up for nothing after all...
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: What are you guys doing?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: You're aiming at me? Really?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Who bought you off?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Nobody, boss.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: It's just a good opportunity to get a promotion.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: An opportunity? I see. Babel's entered the city, and you could take my head to curry favor with them.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: If Babel loses, you can always go back to the Scar Market. Nothing to lose.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Scareye silently looks at the soldiers he set up for the ambush himself.
The wind sweeps past, carrying the faint scent of his blood.
Heh.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: It's a good plan, fellas.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Fate did not kill him. He made it. He had reversed a prophecy.
And then he died atop a stage of his own making.
Londinium, Victoria
The huge palace complex situated in the center of Londinium is always too quiet.
Theresis disdains the apathetic nobles who live within. He only respects those who put their lives on the line to fight a way out and come up to him.
Even if the swords that they raise are pointed at Theresis himself—
Showing mercy to your enemy will only result in your own death, Manfred. Do not repeat that mistake again.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Forgive me, General. I thought—
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Focus on the enemy. It seems these traitors have been sharpening their blades for this ambush for a while now.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: They have stirred the hearts of the Victorians. We are the only ones who can extinguish this rebellion now.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: *Ancient Sarkaz Language*—
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: By the time he murmurs his covert orders, a group of silent figures are already appearing on the chaotic battlefield.
Like a passing gale rattling the raindrops in a storm.
Stand back.
attributes.name: Name-Forsaken Sacrificer

attributes.content: Hmph. We'll handle these guys.
attributes.name: Babel Assassin

attributes.content: Julie, you and the rest keep going.
attributes.name: Babel Assassin

attributes.content: Got it.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Don't even think of getting close to the General.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: No need to rush. It'll be your turn soon.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: I am the General's guard captain, assassin.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Then you're gonna wanna hold your sword tight.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: An inconspicuous arc sweeps past Julie's eyes.
A chill runs through her spine. Her body stiffens.
She thinks of the day that she saw Her Highness in the Scar Market.
At the time, she did not even dare to raise her sword.
Enough, Manfred.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: General!
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: They have come to me in search of an honorable death, not mercy.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: They are using their lives to show me the future as they see it.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You are in a race. She is facing countless threats in Kazdel, just as we are here.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Such a race only ends with my life, or hers.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I will give you a chance. Come, deathmongers. Kill me. Do not disappoint Theresa.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.text: Countdown
2 hours, 7 minutes, 21 seconds

attributes.content: 'SHATTER'.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Th-The gates have fallen! They're about to come through!
attributes.name: Panicked Royal Court Soldier

attributes.text: Countdown
1 hour, 33 minutes, 48 seconds

attributes.content: Notify all operations within the city to disarm the patrolling troops.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The defenses in the city are weak. It's pretty much just the Military Commission's defense forces.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: We'll strike at them before they can regroup. Move fast.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Even if both sides are trying to prevent the battle from spreading into the city, this is still rather irregular.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Send all our intelligence back to the Doctor. All operating teams, quicken your pace, and stay vigilant at all times.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Take down the Military Commission's flag in the plaza, and tune our radio into all frequencies in the city.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.text: Countdown
49 minutes, 59 seconds

attributes.content: Prepare for the landship's connection. We want to let Her Highness and the others enter the region that we control ASAP.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Also contact Ascalon's team and tell them to rendezvous quickly. Three teams have already completed their deployments ahead of schedule.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Where to next, Dr. Kal'tsit?
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The former site of Babel.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Babel's flag has not been raised there for many years.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kal'tsit walks along the street. She's still familiar with the route to Babel's offices.
The Sarkaz on the street quietly move about, climbing as high as they can on the surrounding buildings, gazing at the same ruins within the city.
A flag that has not been seen in Kazdel for many years slowly rises.
Babel has returned.
Mantra's latest report says we've managed to completely clear five main roads.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: If everything is going according to plan, Kal'tsit should have seen the fires of the Soul Furnace by now.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Kazdel's defenses are all but crippled, Doctor. We can board the city now.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: But the Military Commission will not give up on Kazdel. If we want complete control of the city, we still need a bit more time.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: By then, we might not be able to completely avert the destruction of Kazdel's center city—
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Wait.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I felt them.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: They are still here, but they have no intention of aiding anyone.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It seems that some arrogant bystanders have joined our battle.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresa.
attributes.name: Doctor
Theresa
attributes.content: Hmm...

attributes.name: Theresa
attributes.content: I also feel... enemies. Not ordinary ones.
attributes.joined: Hmm... I also feel... enemies. Not ordinary ones.

attributes.content: Their souls burn with killing intent, sorrow, misery and determination.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The Military Commission's assassins. They intended to use the city as bait all along, so they can inflict heavy damage on Babel's headquarters.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: This was also within my calculations. But this time, there is no wagering or planning our way out of this. We must defeat the assassins, then return to our city.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I will go control the landship's defense systems and mount a defense.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Go, Doctor.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: We need not bring another fight into the city, not as it bathes in the twilight afterglow.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.text: Countdown
22 minutes, 48 seconds

attributes.content: Closure, have you made contact with the landship?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Still no response.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I-I'm still overriding the city's broadcast power settings, and trying to expand its range. Maybe the landship's comms have a temporary malfunction... I'm doing my best to bring it back online!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.text: Countdown
12 minutes, 57 seconds

attributes.content: I sense something peculiar, Dr. Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: My mother... She's prepared incantations for every person dear to her heart. When they pass away, an elegy will play in our minds.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I am still in good health at present, but...
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Kal'tsit suddenly feels her blood run cold.
Even if Babel can capture Kazdel, it is bound to suffer grave losses.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Theresis was right. They can't unite. The division of the Sarkaz will be the new norm. Even given a long time, the Sarkaz are unable to go from a weak community to a world leader.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Most importantly, I pointed out another path to Theresis. His plans in Londinium will have a greater chance of success if the Sarkaz corrupt the land with Originium and destroy their enemies.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Isn't this a good thing?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Such a determined race is now our followers. They will become the first brilliant bloodstain on the curtain of Originium as it spreads.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: That's right... We have no need to destroy them. No need to kill her.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I... should use the 'Civilight Eterna'. I should try to guide its hidden functions, and then I wouldn't need to...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.text: Searching internal array. Administrator permissions found.
\n\nVerified. Valid permissions.
\n\nWelcome, Dr. {@nickname}.
\n\nEntering <color=#FF4200>(Shipwide Defense System)</color>. Please confirm subsequent operation.
<color=#000000>Should I really let Babel continue their actions at this point?</color>

<color=#000000>Am I really going to renounce the sacrifices of billions of our people in the distant past, renounce their flesh and blood, ballads and songs, renounce the spark that they have waited for ten thousand years, renounce the Originium Project... all for a race who doesn't even know what the barrier is?</color>
<color=#000000>If, for the sake of Terra, Originium was stopped... If Theresa truly succeeds...</color>
<color=#000000>Then what have we been waiting for during the ten thousand years?</color>
Theresa and the races of Terra... Do they really not have even the slightest chance of success?
<color=#000000>They do not. How could I be so naive as to believe that? They are disunited, narrow-minded, undeveloped... An accident of life, a fortunate survival, that's all.</color>
All lives have the right to believe in their own hopes.
<color=#000000>But we have no time left.</color>
<color=#000000>It is right in front of us.</color>

attributes.content: ...Doctor?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Doctor! Can you hear me?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: That's strange. There are some... peculiarities in the Doctor's emotions.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Intense, and... shadowed.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Doctor, what exactly...?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.text: Look.
There is the fiery light from the torn apart portal, like a smoldering gash across the sky.
Only after centuries will it dissipate into nothingness.
The stars are leaving from where we stand, like leaves trembling in the night.
Yet that ship from Talos-II still arrived at these rubble-strewn ruins.
That is life.
That is what we lost after our final day. That is the ancient ode to dispel any darkness.
To this day, we still do not understand how life appeared in this vast sea of stars.
But I think we should sing the praises of all that lives, and sing our own praises as well.
Originium is our song, the melody we offer to those who come after. Meddling with the evolution of civilization is arrogance, but I had no other choice.

attributes.content: I have reneged on my promise. I have betrayed she who waited within time itself.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: It is because of the love I felt. Love for life. Love for existence. Love is eternally pure. It leaves me unthinking.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: Kal'tsit. Learn to love. Learn to believe. You have to think. Go and lead. Go and face the rolling stones that fall down the hills, screaming as they go.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: But in the end... I believe that you can learn to love. It is eternally pure. It is the child of every breathing creature. It is our nature.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: Go. Kal'tsit. Go see your surroundings, then see what lies by the most distant of mountains. Go seek what forms existence takes. I must go back.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: She had once taught me everything, once explored everything with fervor. But she has changed. She will not give me much time to act of my own accord.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: May we meet again, next time. We will meet again. Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.options: I believe in them. I believe in you, Kal'tsit.
Kal'tsit. I do not have much time left.
Search for traces of life. Search for hope and a future.
Kal'tsit... Go find your own answer.

attributes.text: Are you sure you want to disable the Shipwide Defense System?

attributes.content: Doctor—!
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.text: <color=#FF4200>(Restart boarding ID verification)</color> selected. Confirmed.
\n\n<color=#FF4200>(Restart Shipwide Communications Modules)</color> selected. Confirmed.
\n\nLoading...
\n\nCountdown has reached zero.

attributes.content: The fluorescence of the control panel reflects off the Doctor's mask.
As the screen shuts down, the face beneath the mask is shrouded in darkness again.

attributes.text: How would you describe those who would pay any price to defend their people?
Some would call them heroes. Some would call them legends.
But such titles best take root in times of widespread war.
As a short era of peace begins, in the space of a night, those living legends will all be relegated to the land of stories and tales.
The children who hear such tales will ask: why have all the people who bear such grand titles disappeared?

attributes.content: Because they chose to stay in the past.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: They had seen through their duty, and the new era they founded has no place for them.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Legends are forgotten. Heroes pass out of memory.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: And death arrives as it always does. None can escape it.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Duty spurs a hero to write an answer with death, to tread a muddy road.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: That is our fate.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.text: The eve of Babel's departure from Kazdel

attributes.content: Perhaps after many years, those who were left behind and vanished after we built our home will join us in our causes.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: They will bear a name wracked with infamy and settle this debate for us.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Perhaps.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The twins stand shoulder to shoulder.
By means of the memories stored within the Black Crown, they walk along the battlefield of yesteryear. Just as it was in the past.
The two mixed-blood Sarkaz step off the King's collapsed chariot, walking toward the battle...
Walking toward the future.
So is this where we part ways?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: It is. Here, where we joined hands to change Kazdel, we part.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Even though you have been their King for so many years, at times... you are as you were back then.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Back when we were still young, I would often prick my fingers as I was sewing, staining the robes I would sell. Do you remember?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Yes...
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: At the time, you were still a gloomy recruit, not allowed to wield a real sword, always dreaming of becoming a soldier of Kazdel one day.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I, for my part, still did not understand why we had to hide wherever we went.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But then came the day that the Royal Court took note of my work, and I got to meet Yliš. During that meeting, I summoned my courage to ask the King of Sarkaz—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Where does our future lie?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: He had no answer, only bidding me to leave.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Only once I saw our defeated troops return to their homeland in ruins did I finally understand. The answer I sought could not be found in other lands, but 'here'—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: —In 'Kazdel'.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Kazdel will only return to glory when one of us is gone.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: But the one who is destined to lose is you. Must you persist with this, Theresa?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: There are many by my side who support me.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Most Sarkaz who have suffered oppression and humiliation choose rebellion and violence.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: No matter if those who remain wish it or not, they will eventually be swept along by the tides and drawn into wars.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: But our generation must do something. I do not wish for this hatred in my hand to pass on to the next, where it will continue to fester and grow anew.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Even if I cannot change the future, the hope that will ignite the spark must be carried forward.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I too must take charge of those who follow me.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The cries answering the war do not come solely from Kazdel. There is no place for us anywhere in these lands.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: All I can do is give them a push.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: And so I will stay here. I choose to stay in the past, where the new generation of Sarkaz will one day look back.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Just like you.
attributes.name: Theresis
